pigeon_peas_details.description: Pigeon peas, also known as Congo peas or gungo peas, are a type of legume cultivated for their edible seeds. They are a popular food crop in many tropical and subtropical regions.
pigeon_peas_details.nutritional value: Pigeon peas are rich in protein, dietary fiber, vitamins, and minerals. They are low in fat and cholesterol, making them a healthy addition to a balanced diet.
pigeon_peas_details.uses: Cooking (curries, soups, stews), Dhal (split pigeon peas), Sprouting
pigeon_peas_details.varieties: Green pigeon peas, Yellow pigeon peas
pigeon_peas_details.ripening: Pigeon peas continue to ripen after being harvested, so they are typically harvested when they reach maturity and allowed to dry further.
pigeon_peas_details.harvest season: Pigeon peas are harvested when the pods are fully mature and dry. The timing varies depending on the variety and growing conditions.

prerequisites.soil: Pigeon peas prefer well-drained, sandy or loamy soil with good fertility.
prerequisites.climate: Pigeon peas thrive in warm climates with temperatures between 70°F to 85°F (21°C to 29°C) during the growing season.
prerequisites.water: Pigeon peas require regular watering, especially during flowering and pod development, to keep the soil consistently moist but not waterlogged.
prerequisites.space: Plant pigeon pea seeds or seedlings about 1 to 2 inches deep and 6 to 8 inches apart in rows spaced 18 to 24 inches apart.
